Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: Dtlusty
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for two nights at B&B Farima in Rome and apparently the Cortorillo Hotel manages several B&Bs as well as the hotel. We were offered an upgrade for 20 euros, stated that the upgrade had a private bathroom. (We thought the B&B did when we booked it.) We accepted and were taken down one block to a large building with a lift to the 5th floor where our room included a TV, bathroom, shower and view of the old Acquarium building and its piazza. Apparently, this was the B&B Fanti Rooms, according to the business card on the nightstand. There was a water cooler outside the room and a shared fridge. Unfortunately, the TV remote had to be reprogrammed, a 15 minute test of resolve. Also, the toilet sweat was broken and literally unattached to the toilet, making the bathroom a dangerous adventure. We told the staff about the toilet seat immediately and they promised to fix it. However, two days later, the seat was never fixed. The room would have been a reasonable value had the toilet been in tact. Breakfast was modest and somewhat below average. Unfortunately, a mixed review for this hotel

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel I've ever been”
Reviews.Author: faithfulwishing
Reviews.Content: I had a short visit in Rome and I could tell that this Hotel was a big disappointment to us. The front desk is situated on the ground floor. Exactly on the main street where everyone who passes by can see you checking in. A blond lady received us, she took our IDs and she gave us the impression that she was not aware of the booking we've made nor she has anymore rooms left. But then a man came and take in change. He accompany us to our room and open the door with a duplicate key. I asked for the key of our room but he couldn't give me any because according to the man the blond lady had misplaced it. From then I really freaked out. The Hotel management is really unreliable. The room has a bad illumination. I opened the bathroom and a foul smell suddenly filled the room. I went in to check for it and found out that it's filthy. The shower dish has hairs all over it and then bin has not been empty by the cleaners. I doubt that it hasnt been cleaned at all. I try to move on to settle my things to the closet. The knob of the cabinet is broken and when i open the closet, it was full of blankets and pillows so I didn't know where to put my things so I left them inside my bagage on the foor! Then my breathing felt weird. This usually happens when I'm slightly exposed to dust. And Voi La "DUST EVERYWHERE". There's even no means to communicate to the front desk since there has no telephone inside the room. We had to go there personally from the fifth floor to the main street! When we complained about this, the man was even rude! I was really disappointed so we decided to stay out late as much as possible. The next day I didn't even dare to do breakfast since it was extremely poor! I really had to change the Hotel so we left of course paying the services they promised on their website even we didn't have it at all!!! I wouldn't recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel, even better location!”
Reviews.Author: lisey_lambo
Reviews.Content: Excellent budget hotel. Brilliant location, close to termini, which is the main train station. Everything is is close walking distance, however the metro and bus links and excellent to get everywhere. This hotel is a good base for exploring the city. Rooms are very basic, with quite old furnishings, although has TV and fridge. There is a wet room with shower and hairdryer. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is literally bread and jam with coffee, which was absolutely fine for the busy day ahead. Considering this hotel was so cheap, it was exactly what we expected and perfect what we needed during our stay in Rome. I would definitely recommend it to friends. This is a brilliant budget hotel, no frills. We flew to the smaller airport (Campino) and booked a bus for transport to and from city with terravision.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book the hotel”
Reviews.Author: lwmteresa
Reviews.Content: I had booked the hotel for 3 days and received the confirmation from the Hotel, so I went to check in on time. While I went to the hotel and gave the booking reference to the reception, he checked and then called a man, he said that we (I with my friend - two girls) should follow him and they are the same. So we followed the man to a apartment, there are three rooms in a flat. At that time I had no suggestions, so I paid the monies to the man and he gave me his card. At that time we knew it is a Bed & Breakfast and he gave me a map and also told me how could go the sightseeings. After he left for only 5 minutes, the light shut down suddenly, we were afraid and felt horrible, so I called the man and asked him why. He replied that there was no electric for 2 hours for the whole area. So we left the room and went back to the hotel and ask the receiption. He told me that this areas were always liked this and not be afraid. So I went to had a walked to visit some sight first and then turned back to the B&B before 5:00p.m.. At that time, there was electric. Then I checked my room and found that there was only a window in the washroom which cannot closed. Besides, people could see everything through the key hole. The door of the room is sliding to close that is very dangerous. The washroom had smell. So I hadn't sleep on the first night. The breakfast was having on the 4th floor in one room of a flat, and it was very poor. Then I booked another four star hotel for the following two days. I moved to the new hotel on the second night and checked out the B&B on the third day morning before 9:30a.m.. And I hadn't got back the monies for the third night. The hotel is very unreliable that I booked the hotel before 2 months. If they did't have any room then they could send e-mail to tell me, not the confirmation. When I went to the hotel on the first night, I told the other receiption my stories, he felt it was normal. So I recommend that if you want to book this hotel, you should have a deep think that they may also send you to the other Bed & Breakfast or place.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Rome”
Reviews.Author: samflyer
Reviews.Content: Had 2 weeks in Europe on honeymoon...3 nights in Rome in the Hotel Cortorillo. This is a solid 2 star hotel. The previous reviews are mostly accurate. Here's the good and the bad, first the bad: -bathroom is very small with no shower curtain (everything gets wet) -Air conditioner works, but not well enough to cool the room -furnishings are spartan and low quality -the breakfast is sparse (there is a great bakery 2 blocks down the street) -elevator is small (2-3 person max) -wifi is available but doesn't have a good connection on 5th floor (that's where the rooms are). The good: -price -it has an elevator that works -internet is available on the first floor via a public computer -area is safe and close to restaurants, train station, and central to all attractions -staff is very helpful and friendly -rooms have double paned glass windows (offers some quiet from the noisy streets). Overall, it's an acceptable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough”
Reviews.Author: JCYL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms were clean and tidy with room service provided. Safety lockers provided in the room with TV also. Nice breakfast and free coffee of your choice is provided everyday. The staff are nice and helpful and they offered to hire a taxi to take us to airport at 4am. No wi-fi in the room but free internet provided in the lobby room. Connection was not always okay though. Located close to the train station. Bus stations and metro station are just walks away though I think the area was a bit unsafe late at night. Overall it is a decent hostel at this price range and I will stay in the hostel if I visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and Good location!”
Reviews.Author: ahmao1217
Reviews.Content: It's owned by a family (a mom and a son). The mom doesn't know English. She looks like unfriendly, but actually she is soooooooooooo nice! She made a free coffee for me to wake up in the early morning I checked in! The son is very helpful and polite. He told me where I can buy low priced clothes, and introduced a very good italian restaurant next door (La Mensa di Bacci Rustirante Pizzeria). It's a 2-star hotel, u can't expect what facilities they have. At least they have a good location closed to the train station but safe. After u check in at the small lobby, u have to go out the lobby and go into the building by the entrance next door. They have a very old elevator that u have to open/close the door by yourself. The rooms are located on the 3rd & 4th floor. The room I stayed was clean. The room costed me euro 55/night including simple breakfast. There is a safebox in the room~ There is no curtain to separate the shower and the toilet, and there is no window in the toilet, so the floor would be wet for a long time after shower. Hot water will come out one minute after u switch on the tap. But it's fine for me. They don't provide toothpaste, toothbrush and shampoo, but have a soap and hair dryer on the wall. It takes u 2-3 minutes to the main train station. It's located on the street where so many Chinese open their shops. I don't feel dangerous on the street even at night (I am an Asian female solo traveller). The breakfast place is next to the front desk, a very simple breakfast serving bread, juice and coffee only. U can also take the fruit/bread/snack there anytime u need! Anyway, it's still good value for money in Rome!! I have suggested it for people who travel in tight budget! Tips: They have 24 hrs reception but the staff will lock the lobby door at 11pm for safe, and he may sleeps in the sofa that u have to wake him up if u arrive late or get back ur key on front desk. If then, u better save the telephone number and call the staff a few minutes before u arrive to ensure he is there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great Value For money.”
Reviews.Author: RichardHalifax
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. This is more like a pensione than a hotel. If you want room service don't come here. If you want a clean bed, clean room, plenty of cupboards, drawers, wadrobe space, a hot shower and clean bathroom, mirror for the ladys, TV, then book. 24 hour reception is great, the breky was ok (continental help yourself). You need to check in at street level, not the 5 floors up where all the signs point. The location is ideal for walking and everything and metro etc. The guy behind the dsk was really helpful. It was fine for our trip to Rome. We were only in the Hotel to sleep. If you go to the Vatican Museum (Sistene Chapel) book on line for about 2 euros extra and walk straight in! No queueing. Same for Coleseum.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly disapointed with the Cortorillo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roro82
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfirend stayed here for 4 nights. This place was pretty much awful from the start. Checked in 10pm by a guy at the desk who, although was not rude, he wasn't exactly welcoming and kept converstaion to a minimum. Bathroom was tiny and i mean tiny- approx 7ft by 5 ft. The shower had no curtain so the water went everywhere. There was constantly a horrible sewerage smell coming from the shower drainage. The bedroom size was reasonable for a 2 star but the air conditioning seemed to be just a fan-it didnt acually cool the air. The TV didnt work properly-upper half of the screen didnt work!!! Sleeping was quite unpleasant as it was particulaly wam during the night. Our bedroom was located under the reception so it was particularly noisy in the morning when they were preparing breakfast for the other guests. We toured around rome the following morning and returned to find that the bedlinen and towels had not been changed. When I asked about it at reception they told me that because I didnt leave the room key at the desk in the morning there was way of the cleaner gaining access to the room. But we had not been told to leave keys at reception!!!! They gave me some [--] excuse about having a limited set of extra keys. To avoid a row I just got them to give me new towels and left it at that! Breakfast very plain and was the exact same every day. The only fresd foods on the breakfast menu was the small slices of bread. Overall-i was disapointed with the hotel particularly given that the majority of the reviews appear to be quite postitive. However based on our own experience i find it very hard to justify these reports. I thought 120 euro a night in a 2 star entitled us to a better standard of service and a more conformtable room. Beware of the pictures as theyare misleading and do not give a true illustration of what the place was like.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive oasis in the middle of whirlwind Rome”
Reviews.Author: traveler343
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night in March 2008. We are business professionals in our mid-40's from the US, and no children. A young couple manages the property and they were very gracious. We could tell that they strived to present a good experience for their customers and were very proud of their offerings. We were given a choice between two rooms to sleep in, so we got to inspect two rooms. Both rooms were very clean and had nice decorative touches. Both rooms very nice considering the low price for the hotel compared to other hotels in Rome. Considering the current exchange rate, I would definitely stay at the Cortorillo again for a satisfying and inexpensive motel very close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “close to train station/metro/bus-station, somewhat overpriced, 2-star”
Reviews.Author: PULAOKHAO
Reviews.Content: details of hotel at hotel website [google hotel name] PRO; reasonably clean; room-rate includes cold continental breakfast [assortment of baked goods wrapped in plastic, nothing freshly baked, tea/coffee, fruit juice], refurbished in last few years so furniture in good shape, bathroom had new fixtures, high ceilings; good water pressure so nice hot shower; good location, close to train station/metro/bus-station; lots of restaurants/cafes in all price range close by; McDonalds within a couple of blocks; Many churches & tourist attractions within walking distance CON; Tiny room; no views; paid 70euro including tax for single which seems somewhat overpriced for what they offer TIP; if going to vatican then take bus over metro, that way you get to see more of city, they cost the same; metro/bus tickets not sold at bus station but buy at tobacconist near bus-station; buses can be crowded in rush hour, be careful of pickpockets

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: LeftFork
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel near the train station. It is very simple and cheap for the location. We paid about 80 Euros during the week and a place down the street was 240 Euros. If you want something fancy, don't stay here. If you want something cheap and near the train station, it is a good choice. The elevator did break for part of one day when we were there so we had to use the stairs. If you have problems with stairs this might not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: sophie8
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 nights at this Hotel, and found it really good value for the money, was a little alarmed at first finding that it occupied the Fifth floor of a building, but proved to be of no disavantage as the lift was functional, the staff were so very helpful and welcoming, the room although on the small side was spotless as was the bathroom, the breakfast was adequate, the location under Five minutes to the Metro and Bus,was ideal, the room overlooked a courtyard so was quite peaceful, except for a very noisy cat,

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cheap”
Reviews.Author: fxer
Reviews.Content: Very nice, flexible and friendly staff, average breakfast, pretty good location if talking about transportation, but surroundings are a bit weird, wouldn't recommend single female stick around there in the evening, however I felt safe. The price is fair, would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Simple but great”
Reviews.Author: ignaciot
Reviews.Content: Pros: The staff is very friendly, really 24hs and provides good tips to move around the city. We left really early everyday so I have no idea about how is the breakfast. The rooms were clean and tidy. Cons: It's time to change the curtain showers...

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: RenatoNole
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Cortorillo for two nights in the end of August and was overall satisfied. The hotel is very simple and small, but it was clean and its location was excellent. The hotel is only two blocks away from the Roma Termini Station where you can catch a subway or bus to anywhere in Rome, it is also within walking distance (about 20-25 minutes) from the Colosseum. The breakfast was modest: sliced bread, toast, sweet croissants, industrialized cheese, nutella, jelly, and not much more. The coffee however was excellent. Although the hotel is small, our room was very large. The bathroom was indeed very small, but it wasn't a problem for us. We were worried about complaints about the smell in the room we had read in some reviews, so we made sure to ask if the problem had been fixed when we made the reservation (which we did over the phone). They assured that the complaints were from a specific room only and it had already been fixed, in any case we asked not to be put in that room, and indeed we didn't have any problems with this. If you're going in the hottest time of the year, the air conditioning may be a cause of concern. Ours wasn't working properly, although the night shift receptionist had some trick for fixing it, but it went out again the second day. Since the night had cool weather, we opened the windows and didn't have a problem. If all you're looking for is an inexpensive (we got a really good price, so this has to be taken into account), clean place to sleep where you will have easy access to all the sites in Rome, I would strongly recommend this hotel. I wouldn't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modest hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights from May 22-24, 2006. It was our first trip to Rome and we booked a quad room at an exceptional price (E 395). Though I felt the area was a bit sketchy, the doors are bolted from the inside and the entrance gate is locked at night. Note the hotel is located on the 4th and 5th floors of a building, where you must always pass the reception desk. The hotel staff was helpful, considerate, and very knowledgeable. From internet pictures, the reception area was accurately proportional; however, the dining area (for breakfast) is not as large as it appears to be. Breakfast consisted of an assortment of toasted bread (in packages), jam, croissants, juice and or coffee (plus other little things - cant quite remember). Though it doesn’t seem like much, it was enough to last everyone in my family until lunch. The room was a comfortable size for the four of us. There was a TV (Italian), air conditioning (you had to turn it on), a private washroom, and small fridge (was not stocked). To stock – there was a nice little store between the hotel and the termini that sells groceries (and liquor) for exceptional prices (some better than in Canada). Only fault with the room was the washroom. Though we spent 3 days there, we were not given fresh towels (had to pay extra). This is quite discouraging since (like the picture of the washroom I have added), there was no shower curtain on the shower... so everything got wet. In addition to not having a shower curtain, the toilet tank took a long time to fill (a huge problem with a 4-person room). Also, the sink was pretty plugged, and there was a broken tile on the floor. Just a note, if you decide to stay here - bring a pair of flip flops to use in the bathroom. All in all, because of the price, and the staff I would go back to this place: but definitely not for more than 1 day at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for the marathon, and booked this hotel online. I'm always nervous with an online booking, because quite honestly YOU NEVER KNOW WHAT YOU ARE GOING TO GET. But this worked out great. PROS It's an easy walk from Termini train station (I was nervous about it's proximity to Termini, but I felt very safe)...easy walk to the Colliseum (the start and finish of the marathon)...and pretty much just an easy walk to EVERYTHING. The room was very clean, spacious, had a safe, and breakfast was included (nothing fancy, but still: your choice of cappicino, coffee, or hot chocolate + little prepackaged toast and croissant w/ butter, jelly, and nutella). CONS there is no phone in the room (if that's important to you), the room had a slight funk (smell) to it (which you only really notice when you first arrive), and they almost overcharged me for the room (not by much, but still - best to print out your confirmation and bring it with you).

Reviews.Title: “The beds were the worst!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we first checked into the room, it only had 3 beds but we were a party of 4. It turned out that the fourth bed was the arm chair! This was very uncomfortable because the ‘mattress’ sagged in the middle and created a V shape. We asked for another one, but this one was the same. The other mattresses were also past their use by date. One other disappointing thing was that there was no kettle in the room so to get hot water we had to ask the receptionist outside to get some for us every morning and night. Luckily, the staff are obliging and helpful. The place is clean, the room is very quiet, there is a safe and a fridge and the best thing is- the location!!! It is very central and Termini (the most important station in Rome) is at the end of the road which made travelling a lot easier. The worst thing was really the fourth bed though, because the ‘changed’ mattress was like the first one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Overrated - Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Italy and did all our bookings through the internet. Booked hotel Cortirillo in Rome after seeing all the praises for it on this site and on venere. But I was very dissapointed. First of all this is not a full hotel as in a hotel building. It occupies one floor in an old building. So you dont really get the feel of a hotel. The rooms are just about ok.....I found the atmosphere gloomy, the bathrooms are very small...so if you have a bath and want to dry yourself with a towel you cannot without the towel touching either the commode or the bidet. Moreover there was horrible smell coming from the pipe in the bathroom which we covered with a cloth finally. We had a front room which opened to the street so night time noise also was there quite a bit. There is no phone in the room. Breakfast is fixed and basic but the coffee is good. Now about some good points too. It is a 2 minute walk from Rome Termini ( Station) so that makes it very convenient if you want to travel around by train or metro. Another plus point is that the person at the front desk who was an Indian was very helpful and kind. We asked him various questions about Rome etc which he helpfully answered. Overall, I would not go to the hotel again. We paid 120 euros a nite for a room here and for this price one expects better !

HotelInfo.Name: Cortorillo
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo 79/A, 00185 Rome, Italy
